content: I watched this video on liveleak, no matter what she said or did before hand makes any difference. This police officer was unable to maintian his composure. If he can not handle a girl then what is to happen down the road. He needs thrown off the force and to be held accountable. People like this do not deserve to wear the uniform and clearly are a danger to the public they are sworn to defend. The girl and her family has every right to sue and should. There is no excuse for this type of behavior. A man child that never should have been allowed on the force to begin with. I don't know what method they are using to screen their applicants but surely it needs looked into. This police officer is a complete disgrace to the department and his community. I wouldn't even hire him as a door shaker. Absolutely pathetic.

title: Cop Beats Teenage Girl in Cell

content: "http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/americas/7917295.stm" I saw the video last night - not sure what (if anything) was said, but what provoked the cop was the girl kicking her shoe off in his direction. Notice the cop charges in, feet first, kicking the girl in the stomach instantly followed by a closed fist into the face before grabbing her by the hair, using the fistful of hair to slam her head-first into the concrete wall - then that same handful of hair to throw her facefirst into the concrete cell floor - followed by two closed fisted punches to the back of the girl's head. Once they had her face down, she was lifted up BY THE HAIR and drug out of the cell! In case you didn't know, the girl in question is only 15 - and the cop is 31, - more than twice her age, and has at least 80lbs of weight over her. How many of y'all here have a 15 year old? Quite a few of ya I would figure. How many 15 year olds have a temper or smart mouth, especially when they get in trouble or mad? Just think - that could be YOUR KID that this cop threw around like that. That's why cops like that have to be kicked off the force and sent to prison - to make an example out of them, so other cops don't make the same mistake. This message has been edited. Last edited by: PhoenixDark, Sun 01 March 2009 01:39 PM

content: Even though it was fast, it was also extremely violent. The girl could have easily suffered a fractured skull (from being head slammed into the concrete wall or floor), a broken neck (from being flung from the wall to the floor by the hair - if you watch the video in slow motion, her feet actually come up off of the ground before she is flung down onto the concrete), and/or broken ribs from being slammed down onto the floor. No doubt in my mind, this disgrace to police everywhere needs to spend the next few years in prison - where some big hairy convict can bend him over and make him squeal like a pig every day. What's worse is that the cop had a trainee with him at the time - what's this trainee to think? Will he get the impression that this is ok or justified somehow?

Quite a few of ya I would figure. How many 15 year olds have a temper or smart mouth, especially when they get in trouble or mad? Just think - that could be YOUR KID that this cop threw around like that. That's why cops like that have to be kicked off the force and sent to prison - to make an example out of them, so other cops don't make the same mistake. This message has been edited. content: Even though it was fast, it was also extremely violent. The girl could have easily suffered a fractured skull (from being head slammed into the concrete wall or floor), a broken neck (from being flung from the wall to the floor by the hair - if you watch the video in slow motion, her feet actually come up off of the ground before she is flung down onto the concrete), and/or broken ribs from being slammed down onto the floor. No doubt in my mind, this disgrace to police everywhere needs to spend the next few years in prison - where some big hairy convict can bend him over and make him squeal like a pig every day. What's worse is that the cop had a trainee with him at the time - what's this trainee to think? Will he get the impression that this is ok or justified somehow?

content: "http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/americas/7917295.stm" I saw the video last night - not sure what (if anything) was said, but what provoked the cop was the girl kicking her shoe off in his direction. Notice the cop charges in, feet first, kicking the girl in the stomach instantly followed by a closed fist into the face before grabbing her by the hair, using the fistful of hair to slam her head-first into the concrete wall - then that same handful of hair to throw her facefirst into the concrete cell floor - followed by two closed fisted punches to the back of the girl's head. Once they had her face down, she was lifted up BY THE HAIR and drug out of the cell! In case you didn't know, the girl in question is only 15 - and the cop is 31, - more than twice her age, and has at least 80lbs of weight over her. How many of y'all here have a 15 year old? Quite a few of ya I would figure. How many 15 year olds have a temper or smart mouth, especially when they get in trouble or mad? Just think - that could be YOUR KID that this cop threw around like that. That's why cops like that have to be kicked off the force and sent to prison - to make an example out of them, so other cops don't make the same mistake. This message has been edited. Last edited by: PhoenixDark, Sun 01 March 2009 01:39 PM

Does it look like the cops used excessive force in the video? Yep.. but that silent video clip doesn't tell the whole story, obviously. The officers should be reprimanded perhaps... but prison time? Ya must be jokin, jack. Put down the crack.
reply: It does not matter what she said or did, the cops were completly out of line. Trial and prison...you bet.

title: Cop Beats Teenage Girl in Cell

content: "http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/americas/7917295.stm" I saw the video last night - not sure what (if anything) was said, but what provoked the cop was the girl kicking her shoe off in his direction. Notice the cop charges in, feet first, kicking the girl in the stomach instantly followed by a closed fist into the face before grabbing her by the hair, using the fistful of hair to slam her head-first into the concrete wall - then that same handful of hair to throw her facefirst into the concrete cell floor - followed by two closed fisted punches to the back of the girl's head. Once they had her face down, she was lifted up BY THE HAIR and drug out of the cell! In case you didn't know, the girl in question is only 15 - and the cop is 31, - more than twice her age, and has at least 80lbs of weight over her. How many of y'all here have a 15 year old? Quite a few of ya I would figure. How many 15 year olds have a temper or smart mouth, especially when they get in trouble or mad? Just think - that could be YOUR KID that this cop threw around like that. That's why cops like that have to be kicked off the force and sent to prison - to make an example out of them, so other cops don't make the same mistake. This message has been edited. Last edited by: PhoenixDark, Sun 01 March 2009 01:39 PM

content: Even though it was fast, it was also extremely violent. The girl could have easily suffered a fractured skull (from being head slammed into the concrete wall or floor), a broken neck (from being flung from the wall to the floor by the hair - if you watch the video in slow motion, her feet actually come up off of the ground before she is flung down onto the concrete), and/or broken ribs from being slammed down onto the floor. No doubt in my mind, this disgrace to police everywhere needs to spend the next few years in prison - where some big hairy convict can bend him over and make him squeal like a pig every day. What's worse is that the cop had a trainee with him at the time - what's this trainee to think? Will he get the impression that this is ok or justified somehow?
